translated: Itivuttaka
The Collection of Threes
The fifth section
The attainment of sensual pleasures

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:
“Monks, there are these three kinds of attainment of sensual pleasures.
What three?

analyzed: paccupaṭṭhita kāmāḥ nimmāna ratinaḥ para nimmita vasa vattinaḥ
translated: Sensual pleasures that are ready-to-hand, sensual pleasures that are created by others, & sensual pleasures that are created by oneself.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave tissaḥ kāma upapattiyaḥ ti
translated: These are the three kinds of attainment of sensual pleasures.”
The Blessed One said this.
After saying this, he said further:
“Sensual pleasures that are ready-to-hand,

original: ye devā vasavattino;🔽Nimmānaratino devā,🔽ye caññe kāmabhogino;
analyzed: ye devāḥ vasa vattinaḥ  nimmāna ratinaḥ devā  ye caññe kāma bhogino
translated: the sensual pleasures of the Vasavatti gods,🔽the sensual pleasures of the gods who delight in creation,🔽and the sensual pleasures of the gods who delight in the creations of others,
the state of being a woman, the state of being a man:
one doesn’t get past the cycle of rebirths.
Having known this danger,
the wise one, in regard to sensual pleasures,
would abandon all sensual pleasures,
whether divine or human.

analyzed: piya rūpa sāta gadhita  chetvā sotam duraccaya  asesam parinibbanti
translated: The pleasant, agreeable, & delightful
is cut off at the root, cut off at the base, made like a palm stump, made like a stump, obliterated so that it is no more subject to future arising.
The noble ones, the brahmans, the knowers of the cosmos,
having truly understood, the wise ones,
having directly known the ending of birth,

original: nāgacchanti punabbhavan”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: na āgacchanti punar bhavanti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: they do not come back to renewed existence.”
This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said in “The Greater Discourse on the Destruction of Craving,” so I have heard.
